metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3865 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple directory traversal vulnerabilities in dpkg-source in dpkg-dev 1.3.0 allow remote attackers to modify files outside of the intended directories via a source package with a crafted Index: pseudo-header in conjunction with (1) missing --- and +++ header lines or (2) a +++ header line with a blank pathname.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3865` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dpkg - 1.17.5ubuntu5.3
dselect - 1.17.5ubuntu5.3
libdpkg-perl - 1.17.5ubuntu5.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dpkg package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.17.5ubuntu5.3').
